parsing_instructions.numbering_capture_strategy: Extract the Devanagari numeral enclosed in double dandas (e.g., ।।१।।) at the end of the bolded Mantra text.

start_pattern.description: A new Mantra unit begins with one or more lines of bolded Devanagari text that concludes with a verse number enclosed in double dandas.
examples:
**आवि: संनिहितं गुहाचरं नाम महत् पदम् अत्रैतत् समर्पितम् ।**

**एजत् प्राणन्निमिषञ्च यत् एतज्जानथ सदसद्वरेण्यं परं विज्ञानात् यद् वरिष्ठं प्रजानाम् ।।१।।**

**यदर्चिमत् यदणुभ्योऽणु यस्मिन् लोका – निहिता लोकिनश्च ।**

**तदेतदक्षरं ब्रह्म स प्राणस्तदु वाङ्मनः । तदेतत् सत्यं तदमृतं तद् वेद्धव्यं सोम्य विद्धि ॥२॥**

end_pattern.description: A Mantra unit ends just before the start of the next Mantra (a new bolded verse line) or at the final colophon of the Khanda commentary.

parsing_instructions.pre_content_handling: The initial lines containing the Upanishad title ('मुण्डकोपनिषत्'), section headers ('द्वितीयमुण्डके द्वितीयखण्डः'), and thematic summaries in brackets (e.g., '[सर्वाधारभूतं ब्रह्म]') should be parsed as metadata for the Khanda and not be included in the content of the first Mantra.
